name: Orientation to Agricultural and Resource Econ  Credit
description: Course Description: First year course in agricultural and resource economics and agricultural education. Information and skills necessary to succeed in majors and build an inclusive community in the Department of Agricultural and Resource Economics.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Undergraduate.
column11: Registration Information: This is a partial semester course. Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AREC 180A1 and AREC 192.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural and Resource Economics (GT-SS1)
description: Course Description: Introduction to decision-making by consumers, firms, and government and the resulting allocation of resources through markets.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  MATH 117, may be taken concurrently or MATH 118 or MATH 124 or MATH 125 or MATH 126 or MATH 127 or MATH 141 or MATH 155 or MATH 159 or MATH 160.
column10: Additional Information:  Social & Behavioral Sciences 3C, Economic or Political Systems (GT-SS1).
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AREC 202 and ECON 202.

name: Economics of Food Systems
description: Course Description: Examine the food system using an economic lens. Review the physical, political, and structural context in which the US agricultural system is embedded. Use economic tools and concepts to analyze different components of the food system, as well as potential tradeoffs associated with different policy or other interventions.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Introduction to Agribusiness Entrepreneurship  Credit
description: Course Description: Introductory exposure to entrepreneurship for agribusinesses through presentations by industry professionals.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202, may be taken concurrently or ECON 202, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Required field trips. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural Data Management and Analysis
description: Course Description: A survey of methods and tools to facilitate data gathering, analysis and visualization in a spreadsheet environment. Emphasis on data used in agricultural business and natural resource management.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Issues in Environmental Economics (GT-SS1)
description: Course Description: Discussion and economic analysis of current environmental issues with special emphasis on the impact of economic growth.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column10: Additional Information:  Social & Behavioral Sciences 3C, Economic or Political Systems (GT-SS1).
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 240.
column12: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AREC 240 and ECON 240.

name: Agricultural and Resource Enterprise Analysis
description: Course Description: Use of records in agricultural and resource enterprise management; analytical methods, budgets, and planning techniques for improved decision making.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (CIS 120 or BUS 150 or CS 110) and (AREC 202 or ECON 202).
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Must register for lecture and laboratory.

name: Agricultural Marketing
description: Course Description: Market structure, behavior, and performance including futures market and market games theory.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Agricultural and Resource Product Marketing
description: Course Description: Theory and practice of marketing-differentiated agricultural products and natural resource amenities with focus on strategies and market trends.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Personnel Management in Agriculture
description: Course Description: Human resource issues for agribusiness firms. Managing employees, legal issues, negotiation methods, and benefits packages. Workplace professionalism.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202. Restriction: .
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Small Agribusiness Management
description: Course Description: Apply business principles to small food enterprises, agribusinesses and cooperatives.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Data-Driven Ag and Res Econ Decision Making
description: Course Description: Examine data used to inform decisions in many agribusiness and natural resource organizations. Preparation to use software (e.g., R and Tableau) to acquire, organize, and visualize data with a specific focus on informing business and policy decisions. Organized around real-world problems informed by industry partners and research projects.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 230) and (STAT 201 or STAT 204 or STAT 301 or STAT 307 or STAT 311 or STAT 315).
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Introduction to Econometrics
description: Course Description: Estimating statistical regression models of economic relationships; treatment of special problems that may arise in analysis of economic data.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (ECON 204) and (STAT 201 or STAT 204 or STAT 301 or STAT 307 or STAT 311 or STAT 315) and (MATH 141 or MATH 155 or MATH 160).
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 335.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both ECON 335 and AREC 335. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Introduction-Economics of Natural Resources
description: Course Description: Concepts, theories, institutions; analytical methods for economic evaluation of alternative resource use patterns and land use plans.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 340.
column12: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AREC 340 and ECON 340.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Environmental Economics
description: Course Description: Economic theories and analytic frameworks are developed and applied to contemporary problems of the use and protection of the natural environment.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Water Law, Policy, and Institutions
description: Course Description: Legal water issues within the context of historical, social and economic development with emphasis on the southwestern United States.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Economics of Outdoor Recreation
description: Course Description: Application of benefit-cost framework to public planning for outdoor recreation. Topics include non-market valuation, projecting demand, cost of supplying recreation, and regional economic development.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 346.
column12: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AREC 346 and ECON 346.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural Law
description: Course Description: Laws, regulations, case decisions affecting ranching and farming in the Rocky Mountain area.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Junior.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Junior standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural Production Management
description: Course Description: Economic principles of agricultural production decisions with linear programming analysis of production choices and farm planning.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 305.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Agricultural Finance
description: Course Description: Monetary affairs of agribusiness and agricultural production emphasizing credit institutions and procurement, investment, and management.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 305.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Agricultural Commodities Marketing
description: Course Description: Agricultural marketing and agribusiness principles applied to current marketing problems relating to livestock and field and horticultural crops.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 310.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: International Agricultural Trade
description: Course Description: Agricultural trade patterns and institutions; trade theory with applications to agriculture. Current issues in agricultural trade.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 310.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Commodity Market Trading Experience
description: Course Description: Firsthand experience engaging in futures and options trading in support of business activities. Analyze and trade in commodity markets as investment and risk management tools using economic information to develop trading plans and make use of fundamental and technical analysis to manage trades (real or synthetic). Work in teams, conduct independent research, communicate and justify decision making to other teams, instructors, and industry professionals.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 310.
column11: Registration Information: May be taken up to two times for credit. A maximum of 6 credits may be taken from AREC 419 and AREC 480A2.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Food Supply Chain Management
description: Course Description: Economic analysis of food supply chains studied through industry case studies.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 311.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural Business Management
description: Course Description: Economic analysis, organization, and management practices of agriculture and food industries studied through simulation, case study, computer labs.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 305) and (AREC 310 or AREC 311).
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Senior standing. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Advanced Environmental and Resource Economics
description: Course Description: Microeconomic techniques to rigorously explore economic decision-making and policy as they apply to environmental and natural resource problems.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 340 or ECON 340) and (AREC 341 and ECON 306).
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Water Resource Economics
description: Course Description: An in-depth exploration of the role of economics in water resource planning.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 342 and ECON 306, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 442 and AREC 542.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Economics of Energy Resources
description: Course Description: Supply, consumption trends, and projected demand for alternative energy resources in domestic and world perspective; economics of public energy policies.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ECON 306.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 444.
column12: Registration Information: Junior standing. Sections may be offered: Online. Credit allowed for only one of the following: AREC 444, ECON 344, or ECON 444.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Real Estate Appraisal
description: Course Description: Theoretical principles that underlie real estate appraisal methods. Procedures and practices used in real estate appraisal.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 202 or ECON 202) and (AREC 305 or REL 360).
column11: Also Offered As:  REL 454.
column12: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Credit allowed for only one of the following: AREC 453, AREC 454, REL 453, or REL 454.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Ag- and Resource-Based Economic Development
description: Course Description: Indicators, tools and approaches for agriculture- and natural resource-based economic development in resource dependent countries and communities.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ECON 306.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: A  Study Abroad--Italy: Economics of the Renaissance in Modern Italy
description: Course Description: The historical and current economics of agriculture and natural resources in Florence, Tuscany and Italy. Focus on (1) The role of culture, creativity and place in economic development; (2) Italian culture in general; (3) the economic and political history of Florence; and (4) the production, markets and economic importance of culture and natural resource-based industries in central Italy.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
column11: Registration Information: Sophomore standing. This is a partial semester course. Required field trips. Credit not allowed for both AREC 461A and AREC 482B.Term Offered: Fall (even years).

name: B  Study Abroad--Italy: Food and Resource Economics
description: Course Description: In-depth investigation of the food and natural resource-based economy of Italy through an applied economics lens. Economics and policy are used to provide insight into the integration of Italian culture and its principal food and natural resource industries. A theoretical basis for different resource management systems are presented including various methods of cost–benefit analysis, utility theory, property rights structures, government institutions, and cultural and ethical considerations.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202.
column11: Registration Information: Sophomore standing. This is a partial semester course. Credit not allowed for both AREC 461B and AREC 482A.Term Offered: Fall (even years).

name: Agricultural Policy
description: Course Description: Formulation, evaluation, and administration of public policies affecting the agricultural and natural resource industries in the United States.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202 or AREC 240 or ECON 240.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Supervised College Teaching
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 10 credits allowed in course. A maximum of 10 combined credits for all 384 and 484 courses are counted towards graduation requirements.

name: Agricultural Production Economics
description: Course Description: Empirical applications of production economic theory for use of imputs and allocation of resources in agricultural, natural resource sectors.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (MATH 141) and (AREC 405 or ECON 306).Term Offered: Fall.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.

name: Applied Microeconomic Theory
description: Course Description: Introduction to mathematical models in modern microeconomics, including choices and demand, production and supply, and market structures and failures.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ECON 306.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 506.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 506 and ECON 506.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Applied Welfare and Policy Analysis

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ECON 306.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Financial Management in Agriculture
description: Course Description: Systematic approach to understanding and applying financial management in farm businesses.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 408 or FIN 305) and (ECON 306).Term Offered: Fall (odd years).

name: Agricultural Product Marketing
description: Course Description: Marketing techniques, industrial organization/competition for agricultural products in US domestic, international trade, and developing country markets.

gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.

name: Opportunities in the Agricultural Value Chain
description: Course Description: Explores the economics and business structure of operations within the food and agribusiness system, using readings, field trips and guest speakers.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Required field trips. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Innovation in Agribusinesses
description: Course Description: Core concepts of entrepreneurship within both private and social enterprises. General applications of innovation and entrepreneurship with particular emphasis on the industries that make up the agricultural and food system.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

description: Course Description: Processes of identifying and evaluating a new idea, applying strategic and design-thinking principles and tools to explore pathways by which it could grow into a viable agribusiness.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Entrepreneurial Accounting and Finance
description: Course Description: Foundational background in accounting and financial concepts and mastery of financial tools needed to start a new agribusiness.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Assessing Agricultural and Food Markets
description: Course Description: Foundational background regarding marketing concepts needed to evaluate the potential market for an agricultural or food product or service, using an economics framework.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Business Economics for the Entrepreneur
description: Course Description: Microeconomic framework that a potential entrepreneur can use to analyze business opportunities. Topics include components of cost and revenue and their relevance for new business ventures, determinants and measurement of consumer demand, and alternate forms of business organization and interaction.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 202 or ECON 202. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Entrepreneurial Identity and Team Formation
description: Course Description: Students explore their emergent identity as "entrepreneur", including their necessary interdependence on other members of a team when engaged in creative endeavors such as innovation or new business development in the agricultural space.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 513. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Must register for lecture and laboratory. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Raising Capital in the Agricultural Sector
description: Course Description: Methods to value a startup business and approaches to identifying sources of capital needed to launch and sustain the startup. Emphasis on unique challenges in and sources of raising capital in the agricultural sector.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 512 and AREC 514. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: A  New Venture Communication
description: Course Description: Communicating in the workplace, both orally and in written form. Development of a succinct business proposal.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 517, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. This is a partial semester course. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: B  New Venture Communication
description: Course Description: Emphasis on oral communication when trying to sell a business idea to potential investors. Development of tailored presentations to target audience within moments of opportunity.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 519A. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Intellectual Property in Food and Agriculture
description: Course Description: Explores the critical role that intellectual property plays in commercial activities within the knowledge economy. Emphasis on strategic management of technology through patents and other control mechanisms, thereby allowing startups to survive and thrive in the knowledge economy with special attention to property developed in the agricultural and food systems.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 518 and BUS 660. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Summer.

name: New Food Product Development
description: Course Description: An overview of the food product development process. Topics include strategies, marketing perspectives, quality controls and supply chains in the food system.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 515. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Summer.

name: Applied Agribusiness Decision Tools

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 305 or AREC 408 or FIN 305) and (ECON 306).Term Offered: Fall (even years).

name: Agricultural Price Analysis

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Applied Econometrics

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 335 or ECON 335) and (ECON 304 or ECON 306).
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 535.

column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 540.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 540 and ECON 540.Term Offered: Spring.

gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 541.

column11: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 542 and AREC 442.Term Offered: Spring.

column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 563 and ECON 563.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Methodology of Economic Research

column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 570 and ECON 530.Term Offered: Fall (even years).

column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring (odd years).

name: A  New Venture Launch Practicum: Explore and Validate Value Proposition
description: Course Description: Team-based development of a new venture or innovation focusing on co-creation of value. Four main areas of competency--(1) entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork; (2) technology and product development; (3) communication and substantiation of value; and (4) business strategy and execution--are developed and demonstrated in the process of preparing to launch a new venture or innovation in the agricultural, food, or related industries.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 517, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing.Term Offered: Spring.

name: B  New Venture Launch Practicum: Communicate, Design, and Iterate
description: Course Description: Team-based development of a new venture or innovation focusing on co-creation of value. Four main areas of competency--(1) entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork; (2) technology and product development; (3) communication and substantiation of value; and (4) business strategy and execution--are developed and demonstrated in the process of preparing to launch a new venture or innovation in the agricultural, food, or related industries.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 586A, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing.Term Offered: Summer.

name: C  New Venture Launch Practicum: Final Evaluation, Presentation, and Launch
description: Course Description: Team-based development of a new venture or innovation focusing on co-creation of value. Four main areas of competency--(1) entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork; (2) technology and product development; (3) communication and substantiation of value; and (4) business strategy and execution--are developed and demonstrated in the process of preparing to launch a new venture or innovation in the agricultural, food, or related industries.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 586B, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Course may be taken multiple times for maximum of 12 credits total.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural Production and Cost Analysis
description: Course Description: Empirical application and analysis of production and cost issues in the agricultural and natural resource sectors.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 506) and (AREC 535 or ECON 535). Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Spring.

column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 606 and ECON 606.Term Offered: Spring.

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 535 or ECON 535) and (ECON 501, may be taken concurrently). Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 635.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 635 and ECON 635.Term Offered: Fall.

description: Course Description: Economic literature-based exploration of human welfare measures and implications of approaches to agriculture and resource-based economic development.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 506. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Spring.

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ECON 306 and MATH 141. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall.

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.

name: Thesis

description: Course Description: Advanced topics in microtheory: game theory; market imperfections; adverse selection; principal-agent problems; social choice theory; incentives, etc.

column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 706.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 706 and ECON 706.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Econometric Theory II
description: Course Description: Econometrics models and estimators in econometrics, from fully parametric to semiparametric and nonparametric approaches.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 635 or ECON 635. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 735.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 735 and ECON 735. This is a partial-semester course.Term Offered: Spring.

name: A  Advanced Econometric Methods
description: Course Description: Econometrics analysis of: Discrete Choice Models.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 735, may be taken concurrently or ECON 735, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 736A.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 736A-C and ECON 736A-C. This is a partial-semester course.Term Offered: Spring.

name: B  Advanced Econometric Methods
description: Course Description: Econometrics analysis of: Panel Data Models.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 735, may be taken concurrently or ECON 735, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 736B.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 736A-C and ECON 736A-C. This is a partial-semester course.Term Offered: Spring.

name: C  Advanced Econometric Methods
description: Course Description: Econometrics analysis of: Time Series Models.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 735, may be taken concurrently or ECON 735, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 736C.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 736A-C and ECON 736A-C. This is a partial-semester course.Term Offered: Spring.

name: D  Advanced Econometric Methods
description: Course Description: Introduces the notion of identification in econometrics and covers several commonly used methods for addressing endogeneity.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 735 or ECON 735. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 736D.
column12: Registration Information: This is a partial semester course. Credit not allowed for both AREC 736D or ECON 736D.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Advanced Natural Resource Economics
description: Course Description: Advanced theory, methods, and literature in natural resource economics, including dynamic programming and optimal control.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 706 or ECON 706. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 740.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AREC 740 and ECON 740.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Advanced Environmental Economics
description: Course Description: Advanced theory, methods, and literature in environmental economics.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AREC 706 or ECON 706. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Spring.
column11: Also Offered As:  ECON 741.

name: Advanced Methods in Applied Economics
description: Course Description: Advanced research methods in applied economics: lab and field experiments, non-market valuation and discrete choice experiments.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (AREC 706, may be taken concurrently or ECON 706, may be taken concurrently) and (AREC 735 or ECON 735). Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall (odd years).
